Reviews.Title: “cheap and clean place to visit london”
Reviews.Author: graziella l
Reviews.Content: no luxeries, ideal for small budget when you are a four people family! room, sheets, towels, private little shower room and toilet are clean, the staff is helpful and friendly. the bus and the tube are near (zone 1) and you can find many different possibilities to eat around. we enjoyed our stay and we will come back. the tea is very good and the breakfast is generous enough to help you to walk hours in london! grace from france

Reviews.Title: “good budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Lucia M
Reviews.Content: The Windsor house hotel offers budget accomodation with everything you need for a nice london trip with no luxuries. The rooms are clean and the staff is really helpful and friendly. If you want a place to sleep that is convienently located near earl's court and dont expect any luxuries this place is for you. During the day you can use the kitchen downstairs, which is convenient for a little break from city life. Lucia from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Sleep here if you don't mind sleeping with one eye open.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: This was our scariest hotel experience during our two weeks in the UK. After climbing the steep stairs to our room, we discovered the locks don't actually fully engage. In fact, we were able to enter with a credit card (no, we are not thieves). After that, we were informed that our toilet was up another flight of stairs. We decided to forgo the shower, as it did not appear too clean. We were thankful for the fan that was in the room, we assume that was because all the heaters in the building were cranked on high. There were no amenities to speak of and we missed breakfast to make our train, but truthfully we were a little frightened of what it might be like. There was a sign saying you needed to wait for personnel to check you out of your room. After waiting 15 minutes, we found all we had to do was hand him the key. Thanks for helping us almost miss our train. Overall, we would not recommend this hotel. Although it is just around the corner from the train station, it was not worth the financial savings.

Reviews.Title: “A nice down-to-earth Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sventhesheep
Reviews.Content: I am student from Germany and stayed this year (2012) the third time in four years in the windsor house hotel. All three stays turned out to be a good location for students, who want to explore Englands capital. Overall, since my first stay the house has inproved in friendlyness, cleanlyness and breakfast. It is, of course, not the hilton, but it is what you'd expect from the price and it's a fine hotel for that. If they keep the momentary standard of cleanlyness and friendlyness I can really recommend the hotel for those who want to see London and have a well located, not too pricy place to stay. Have a nice stay. I am sure I will come back and planing already to do so this year.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Flemming A
Reviews.Content: I had 4 nights at this hotel - that I would call a good old B&B more than a hotel. The room was clean, the service was great. It doesnt have any luxery, but as the titel says - you get what you pay for. The location makes this a great place to stay - and the fact that you can use the kitchen as you want, doesnt make it worse. If you are looking for a new fancy shiny hotel - this isnt for you, if you need a clean cheap place to stay, I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good location.”
Reviews.Author: Lisenielle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early December. We had to move rooms twice, even though we had booked the room months in advance. The rooms were cold, even with the heater at full blast, and quite dim. The breakfast was good! However, if you could get a Travelodge at the same price, please do so!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Laura O
Reviews.Content: Very modest, basic accomodation. Not for people looking for luxury, but more designed for people looking for a place to leave their bags, and have a bed for a night. Very close to Earls court station. Very friendly staff, and a very clean place. The use of the kitchen is handy, especially if you have kids ect, but in saying that, there are a lot of stairs, so wouldn't advise if they are very young. Over all, done the job for us, will stay again, if I'm on a quick stop over to london, and for what you pay for the accom, deff worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, Well Located and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Enzo C
Reviews.Content: If you are leaving the room in the morning to see London, walk in the museums, in the shops and all the beauties of the town, coming back tired at night, you cannot find anything better at this price. We stayed 6 nights, the five of us, including my daughters of 19, 16 and 6 and we had a very good time. Breakfast is not that varied and mattresses are old, but if you are tired after a day out you to sleep in seconds and forget them. The bathroom is slightly bigger of the toilet of an airplane, but there is room for a small shower. Around the hotel there are plenty of restaurants, fast foods and places to buy foods; if you want you can buy food and eat in the kitchen. And the tube station is just 3 minutes walking. If you want to spend time in the hotel I definitely suggest to look for something else, but be ready to pay at least twice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Rachel S
Reviews.Content: Our stay was really nice, 3 nights in a clean and warm double room with itÂ’s own shower and toilet . Freshly laundered sheets, fresh and comfortable bedding, comfy pillows, daily cleaning, and all for the price of Â£52 for 2 peops including everything. We had been reading the reviews on this site and expected minuscule showers - well - it depends on your size ? We fitted and utilized these just fine Â– and they looked clean, smelled clean and were clean. ItÂ’s an early breakfast, copious Â– and they serve it with a smile and offer seconds. We only made it down once ( but we were out late Â– till all hours ) and the days we missed they let us in to make bits of our own, after theyÂ’ closed Â– and provided tea and coffee. ItÂ’s a B&B Â– and we didnÂ’t expect all day service.The location is superb - shops, cafes, and we walked to the local major High street (Kensington). If the traveller wants a chi-chi Town House with frills and fancies Â– then they have to be prepared to pay 3 times the price. If honest and simple and homely B&B will do Â– at the right price - then the Windsor does exactly that. Some of the reviews really amused us - germophobes travelling the world in fear of cholera or some such. . do we really want to know ? We have booked for February Â– and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Location*****clean rooms*****”
Reviews.Author: Michalina K
Reviews.Content: Three days in London - for shops â€“ and we had good time. Staying very near to all â€“ tube and busses closeby - hotel was like home â€“ clean room, clean beds, gut shower, and people very kind â€“ helping with information things and welcome every day. Breakfast was fine too - eggs and toast and a lot. We paid very little for 3 in one room with 3 beds â€“ and so we could spent more on the shopping.! We could make coffee and cake in the kitchen when we came home. It was great and we come back in easter. Thank you Windsor House.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BudgetTraveller27
Reviews.Content: The windsor house hotel is one of the cheapest hotels I could find in London. The location is very nice, 3minute walk to the Earl's court subway station, close to pubs and restaurants, a grocerie store near by. These are the only good things about this hotel. I stayed in a double room with private bathroom that looked like a plastic box. The size was similar to an airplane bathroom. The room was a little dusty.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful”
Reviews.Author: BrightonLewii
Reviews.Content: As a poor student living outside of london, it was hard to see any shows in central so we decided to get a b&b for the night. This however, was awful. There were 5 beds in the room, all of which has mattresses from around 10 years ago... Lumpy and soft! Just pay a bit more and go to a nicer hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Horror Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but i have never stayed anywhere as bad as this its absolutely awful, we arrived here on Sat to find we had to wait about 10 mins for someone to let us in and when we eventually got in and we were shown to our room with no toilet (terrible) after complaining we were told we could move rooms on the Sunday but not Saturday and the toilet was up 2 flights of stairs, we even checked out other hotels in the area but all full so had to put up with it, wouldnt mind but it was my husbands anniversary present from me. Note to anyone NEVER NEVER stop here it should not be open to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: jan a
Reviews.Content: As they says: we are homely and very modest with NO luxuries, its true. The room is small but clean. Breakfast: toast w butter and jam, egg, milk, coffe and tee, we think it was OK. located in Earls court, close to subway, about 6 station to Picadily = great location of the hotel and very calmly area. Great budget hotel in london. we where 2 adults and 2 kids, 6 and 9 yrs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: patana1971Lisbon
Reviews.Content: Despite they have told me there was a toilet inside the room the only thing we had it was a shower! Very old hotel with small rooms. Breakfast poor (toast with butter or jam, milk and coffee). You get what tyou have paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but expect the worst”
Reviews.Author: Fteun
Reviews.Content: Dont go here if you can help it! The hotel is cheap but old and decrepit and you'd be well advised to find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It shouldn't be allowed to operate”
Reviews.Author: Jim R
Reviews.Content: Filthy dirty place, they tried to move us after one night to a room without a toilet but we went somewhere else. Had to leave the 3 kids there as we could not find another 2 rooms together.. Management was asked 3 times to call me but obviously couldn't or wouldn't find the time to do so. The Hotel has no elevator and no wi fi yet charge the same price as adjoining hotels that do offer these things

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you have no other option”
Reviews.Author: Ammy M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely basic in facilities provided, even more than appears from the website. They were quite inefficient too, as our room was not ready when we arrived and we had to dump our luggage there and just leave, even without taking a shower. The shower cubicle inside the room is tiny, with a transparent door. The breakfast is just toast butter jam and an egg, each and every day. Not even juice, though there is tea and coffee. That said, it's quite clean, although there is a common loo for most rooms whose state totally depends on your fellow lodgers (we were bit unlucky in that) Stay here only if you are on a budget and have no other better option.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is everything it claims to be”
Reviews.Author: Trish H
Reviews.Content: This hotel classes itself as simple no frills accomodation, it was perfect for us as a family of 5 looking for somewhere clean to lay our heads. It is clean and friendly and the light breakfast is perfect to set you up for the day. Use of a fridge and the kitchen during the day is perfect to keep your stay in London affordable particulaly if you have young children. We were on the top floor but again the website is very clear about the stairs so no suprises. The location is perfect, being a five minute walk from the underground and 15 minutes into central London.. There are plenty of shops and eateries literally 2 minutes walk away. We will stay again when we take a return trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: PaulaR57
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were modest. However, the facility was clean and provided knowledgable staff. The rooms were small, as were the bathrooms, but I can't stress enough the cleanliness and the location of the hotel. It was located within 2 to 3 minutes of the tube, eateries and an internet cafe (which was important to us to be able to stay in contact with the two parents of the grandchildren traveling with us.) Booking was also a breeze and went very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “One big sadness!”
Reviews.Author: GTHvanpuffelen
Reviews.Content: Pigs Hotel I've never seen such a horrible mess and terrible hotel like this! We have booked a family room but it liked a pig stable. You don't get a breakfast, while there are not enough places available in the room to eat your breakfast. A woman said: "Breakfast is over now, it is "nine o'clock." We had waited since 08:00 am. The showers doesn't work in the rooms and are very dirty! If you think this is a B&B, it isn't! Pigs have a better place to sleep and eat. The beds are very bad, you can feel the springs every bed . You can better sleep on the floor. There are no electric sockets to get your hair done. We were shocked about this. We'll never stay again here, it is ONE BIG SADNESS!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tippcitymom
Reviews.Content: The location was very close to Earl's Court Tube station. Easy for my children to walk with suitcases in tow from the Tube to the Hotel. The sheets and towels were clean. Very basic breakfast included cornflakes, toast, and hard boiled eggs. Bathroom was miniature and the shower leaked onto the floor. Otherwise good for the cost. Surprisingly quiet street!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: mrfyda
Reviews.Content: Bugs in the room and inside the bed!!!!!!!!!! I was bitten all over. The breakfast room stank. The condition of the room was miserable. Don't stay in this hotel for any reason! Even if it's for free!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: SBMedico
Reviews.Content: A homely family type B&B accommodation. We liked staying at this hotel. There were 40 of us who stayed there after coming from a pilgrimage in Europe. Everyone agreed that it was a good choice. The hotel is near the Earl's Court Tube Station. There are many restaurants nearby so having a meal was easy. Our group occupied several rooms from single rooms to 6-bedders. Breakfast was included in the stay and we were surprised that aside from the regular continental breakfast, we even had one boiled egg each. What a treat! We also had use of the kitchen throughout the day. I will recommend this to anyone who is on a budget, but wanting to stay in a place which is accessible to transport and restaurants. Will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worst London experience of my life !!”
Reviews.Author: bilko61
Reviews.Content: This place is NOT what is described and in my opinion should be shut down immediately !! It is run by a dodgy conman on the so called reception. Firstly I booked two rooms through Late Rooms.com. 4 days prior to our arrival I rang the hotel as I had been previously instructed to book a parking place for our son who was travelling up from Dorset to join us for a family weekend in the capital. I was told we only had one single room booked, upon further investigation I found this to be true, he later phoned me to offer a room for all 4 of us, which I accepted, cancelling with late rooms.com and I dealt direct. The hotel is like a doss house, wallpaper hanging off, lumpy wobbly beds. The so called shower in the room was like something out of a caravan which made it even more cramped. The final straw came upon our departure when I handed the keys in and asked for my Â£10 deposit back, the aforementioned dodgy reception guy said I'd never paid one.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Elvira16
Reviews.Content: We had booked for five nights and were looking forward to the 'super-clean, comfortable and friendly' accommodation that we had been promised in the booking confirmation. On arrival we were met by a very impolite receptionist who was barely communicating with us. If we had not paid a deposit not to be returned we would have left immediately. We do not want to complaint about the facilities as we knew that it is a budget B&B, but unfortunately the rooms were not very clean. Some of us had to share the toilet with the neighbours and it was obvious that some of them were smoking in there - with poor air conditioning.. Breakfast was toast and one egg for each person, no juice for the children. We chose to buy supplies in the M&S nearby. The kitchen and the tableware were not very clean. Some of the staff, however, were friendly and helpful. Thank you! Location was very fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for affordable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: albaeder
Reviews.Content: I (we) stayed at Windsor House as a group of 37 on a school study tour (from California). Affordability was very important to us. The hotel is not fancy by any means. It provides basic accomodations, a simple breakfast each morning and very convenient access to transportation at Earl's Court. The staff is very helpful, flexible with room arrangements to meet needs and willing to do what they can to help. Use of the kitchen was helpful. Showers/bathrooms are available in the hall as well as your room - very helpful for a group with several per room. The mornings we had to leave early they packed a breakfast for our entire group. They provide good basic accomodations at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “For the budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: Shree221B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the budget conscious -provides free use of the kitchen to cook your own lunch/dinner. Tea/coffee is unlimited. It is a stone's throw from Earl's Court tube station with various takeaways and grocery shops close by. Breakfast is sufficient, The staff is warm and friendly. Highly recommended for the budget conscious

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, located in zone 1 with a friendly hotel management- Worth every Pound!”
Reviews.Author: Badfan2
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a budget hotel, clean and in the heart of the city, then Windsor house is a good option. Its about 5 minutes walk from the Earls court station and is located in the posh zone 1 of London. The rooms although small are clean and the people managing the place are friendly and very helpful. I checked out in the morning and the hotel staffs were kind enough to look after my bags till I collected them later in the evening. The hotel doesnt have elevators, so do make sure your knees carry you to the third floor if the need be. There are common washrooms available across the floor. My room did include a very small bath area with a shower. Will definitely recommend this place for solo travellers in for a short visit to london.

Reviews.Title: “Budget means basic, NOT dirty.”
Reviews.Author: TravelandTeach
Reviews.Content: I understood when I booked this B and B that it was a budget accommodation - no frills. I didn't expect that would mean no hygiene, however. There were places in my room and in the shared toilets that had not seen a vacuum cleaner or sponge in a LONG time. (I wrote in the dust, just to see what would happen - nothing.) The email I received that described my room said that the ensuite shower was "new". I'd hazard a guess it was new when Prince William was born; it literally had several screws loose, and the showerhead was so calcified that there was next to no water pressure. I thought about asking for my money back and trying my luck down the road, but the signs in the front hall made it very clear that NO REFUNDS would be offered. It's a shame; the location is great, and the people are very friendly. All it would take is a little time and TLC to make this a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Warren137
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four days together with our children, a teenager, a six year old and a two year old. The hotel is as advertised, very basic, but what it lacked in glam it definately made up for in cleanliness, value for money and the staff were absolutely amazing. The breakfast was more than sufficient, the coffee was great! And there was loads of it. From the time that we made our reservation, Mrs Wardle was more than accommodating, even reserving a ground floor apartment for us as it was too difficult for us to negotiate stairs with a push chair and toddler in tow. The lovely lady in the kitchen, who also cleaned our room, took exceptionally good care of us. The gentleman at reception were more than happy to assist us with our luggage, storing it for us. I strongly recommend this hotel for families and especially those watching their budgets, our rand is incredibly weak against the pound, so every bit counts. And lastly the location - I could not have asked for better, a quick (not even 3 minute) walk around the corner to the subway, resturants / take-aways and supermarkets a stone throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly B&B for resting after sightseeing in London,for those who don't want to spend much and don't look for luxuries.”
Reviews.Author: kathygreek
Reviews.Content: My sister and I (uni students) spent a couple of nights in Windsor House Hotel and we are pretty satisfied. The location is excellent, as it is right next to earls court metro station and also the bus 74 goes you to natural history and science museums,hyde park corner and madame tissauds. The staff was very very friendly and helpful, we asked for directions and a hair dryer and there was no problem. The breakfast was toast bread, butter, jam, egg, cereals, filter coffee,milk and tea and was served by a very gentle lady. The kitchen was also available for those who want to cook! No luxuries but clean and in good price. Just what we were looking for, a place to stay after seeing the famous sites of London!

Reviews.Title: “Next time in London we also will stay at Windsor House”
Reviews.Author: bosse_albin
Reviews.Content: We arrived early friday morning, left our luggage at the hotel and walked out to have a few hours in London before entering our room. When we came back and get our room the luggage was already there. The room were on the third floor and it was calm and quiet ok.The breakfast in the morning was tasty and big .If you are going on a short holiday to London we will recommened to stay at Windsor House.

Reviews.Title: “A simple ideal base for daily sightseeings , no frills.(Not so much clear)”
Reviews.Author: demis19662
Reviews.Content: I m 48 years old,batchelor, and not so demanding in luxurities.I had book thru internet directly to this hotel as it was featured on the Bed and Breakfast advertisements. I stayed from 21-25 March 2011 at a single room and as the manager described it on the e-mail confirmation she sent to me:''a very nice twin basic (small and cosy) room with washbasin inside the room and shower and toilet close to the room for sole use of this room-very convenient- at a price of STP 39.87 inclusive breakfast and VAT....pls note that we are budget accomodation standard-super clean-(!!!!) confortable and friendly etc etc.Also that ''a wellcome tea will be prepared for me upon arival''--never I had that tea... What I found:The room was at the loby of the Hotel and toilet &shower were located at the basement 15 stairs down for everybody use. I had to request twice to the receptionist to ''labelize'' at the door of the toilet ''for the sole use of room Nr...'' and he did , BUT the toilet had no locker and was used from other persons too..As for the warm water this was coming out from an on-wall electric heater ..not feeling so safe.. Appart from this of course there was not any radio and TV on the room ,fortunatelly because there was not any noise insulation.. Also, as heating means there were just a tiny electric radiator and a wall heater, I was lucky the weather was very good... Room cleaneless.:HA ,HA ,HA... Hotel needs a top to bottom renewal.. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was coffe,tea,toasts, butter, marmelade and eggs.Milk and corn flakes were provided too. The plus was the close to City distance through the Earls Court Station. The area is well known for its low cost Bed&breakfast Hotels a medium-low budget area.As i have been told from the staff the owner is an old lady and her doughter is managing this B&B Hotel from a distance although she stays a couple of blocks away,she hardly visits the hotel and aparently there is lack of ''personal interest'' .Also this ''Hotel'' request about two days as a deposit -no refund for cancellations-and the balance in cash otherwise they charge about 5% surcharge using a credit card. Finally I had never received a machine or an official receipt for the amount of STP 159.48 I paid apart from two handwritten ''receipts'' on an Hotel labeled name small paper.Something we dont have in my country and in most countries in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and amenities. Will definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Zulk510
Reviews.Content: A good value B&B in a superb location.My family have a great time. We had the x4 bedded family room with WC. The WC is on the small side (cramped) but it is convenient. The outside WC provided is much bigger. The building and facilities is old on the inside but serviceable. The staff are friendly and courteous and helpful. The breakfast provided is basic; cornflakes, toast and eggs but plentiful. This is a budget hotel, so treat it as such in your expectations, The buses and underground just a short distance aways. Supermarkets, deli , cafe and fast food outlets are plentiful - just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the majority of London's attractions”
Reviews.Author: chrisdodsworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I will return to this hotel on a future occassion. It is ideally located and well serviced by buses and the London Underground, which are only a 100 to 150 metres walk away. This is a budget hotel, so treat it as such in your expectations,The staff are friendly and courteous and helpful. It is simply appointed and offers a good night's sleep. It does not suffer from traffic noise, being located conveniently off Earls Court Road. The bedding and towels were nice and clean. The continental style breakfast was plentiful and the room we had was very warmly heated. Ideal for cold winter, spring and autumn nights.

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LeilaBustoA_Italy
Reviews.Content: I like considering myself as a "usual customer" because I've been staying at the Windsor I don't know how many times since I first sent a couple of friends back to 2004. I like the position, the extremely lovely, helpful and welcoming staff, the price, the cleanliness. It's like being home from home. Ok, it's not the Plaza, but when you travel, are you more interested in price, comfort and friendliness or in how big and luxurious your room is? And you can even cook if you are travelling on a budget. What else can you ask for? Leila

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay like at home...”
Reviews.Author: MTN17
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Windsor house. Although the hotel doesnâ€™t have luxuries and frills, it is always clean and is comfortable. But one of the best things is that the staff is really helpful and friendly (they help you in all that you need, information about the services, rooms, and the places you can visit etc. They try to make your stay very easy and try to satisfy all your needs). Moreover the location of the hotel is excellent because is situated in zone 1 so you are going to save money when you take the tube. The breakfast was good and if you want to cook you can use the kitchen. (Thank you from Spain).

Reviews.Title: “value for money with no frills”
Reviews.Author: ymei
Reviews.Content: my family and I stayed there for a few days for the Dec period and it was value for money. There was extra heaters in the room which we could use when we felt cold and the kitchen was open for us to do our own cooking. Beds were comfy too and our whole family could take a room to ourselves. The staff was also friendly and helped whenever we asked. Place is within walking distance to earls court, which is on the same tube line from the airport and kings cross station. Many shops nearby to get necessities or food. Overall great for those who are not demanding and want to travel on a budget

Reviews.Title: “A Really Lucky Find”
Reviews.Author: finsfings
Reviews.Content: 'Have stayed in this area on business before and have always needed a small budget accommodation, so to find the Windsor House Hotel on the internet was just a great find .Centrally located,in a surprisingly quiet road 5 minutes from Earl's Court tube station and near to the exhibition centres of Olympia and Earl's Court and with late opening good food shops in the area the use of the kitchen/diningroom is a most useful amenity -and talking of food the no frills breakfast (but with the largest teapot I can recall in all my travels) starts at 7.30am -even on Sundays The hotel was very clean ,good firm beds,with basin and shower in the bedroom but with conveniently near shared toilets-and no lift this is probably not a hotel suited to those with a young family ( the over 60's like me should manage the stairs)

Reviews.Title: “Dismal and disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Fluffybaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is described in the very nice email we received from the owner as 'no frills but with a very nice 4 bedded room with private shower (new!) ideal for you. The room was actually only big enough to comfortably take 2 beds. the shower was like a plastic sealed 'box' in the corner of the room. It was not new by any stretch of the imagination and when you sat on the loo your knees were in the shower!! The place has probably not been decorated since the 1970s and everything is very old and dated. The beds had very soft, sagging and VERY lumpy mattresses. Outside our window on a flat roof about 4 feet below were a variety of items including a packet of something which looked like some sort of drug and a used condom!! On the positive side we did get moved to a bigger room but that only had a bath and no shower. Also the sheets and towels were nice and clean. The breakfast is very basic but okay and I did appreciate the real butter and lots of it. Yes this hotel is cheap but it would be nice to have something to look forward to going back to at the end of a tiring day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Marishad13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in London for 6 days. I was looking for B&B for 3 persons in a room (our 3 years old son needs a separate bed). I checked more than 20 hotels, the price was doubled than what we paid here. Our room was for 2, but Mrs.Jan arranged one more bed in the same room, so we could save the money. For the place to stay/sleep 6-7 hours a day it was enough. We lived on the 1-st floor, it was good since there is no elevator. We've got a room with the little cabine (toilet and shower). Hot water, good pressure. The breakfast was simply, but really ok. The location is really great, 30 min. from Heathrow Direct line, 2 minutes walking from the tube station Earl's Court to the hotel, the London center is 2-3 stations away. If you want to see London and not to waste money on luxury, go ahead :)

Reviews.Title: “First impresion very friendly staf. Clean basic but al you need.”
Reviews.Author: tashanick
Reviews.Content: They met my expectations. The friendliness matter to me. Place was clean that is # 2 important for me. House in old Victorian style with high ceilings. Very basic no luxury but we had all we needed. Kitchen was useful to us. Very good location 1st zone, tube station just behind the corner. Just what we needed. Good bargen would recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms - extra: stairs, good exercises for your botty :)”
Reviews.Author: smilyHUN
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed there at Windsor House. We liked it, we got what we were told. No luxury, but Friendly helpful staff, clean rooms, with clean huge towels :) Every day they hoovered the floor (carpet), and set the beds, even my clothes left on them. The bathroom was not really a bathroom but a shower cabin in the corner and a small wash-basin with big mirror. For the purpose it was OK! Toilet was in seperate room outside our room, shared with others. But all was always clean!!! Breakfast was nice, though boring for a whole week, but more than enough! The staff service was nice, they are regardful. Friendly dining room, with entrance to a terrace. Every evening we used the kitchen for a hot mug of tea. Wow, and those stairs ... I was unhappy about missing my trainings while I am travelling, but those stairs replaced it :) Really rocked my heartbeats :) Good morning exercise to get to the 4th floor!!! Especially after breakfast :)) The hotel is so close to Earls's Court Underground, and there are plenty nice shops around, also post office, internet caffee, market, pub :) All in all we liked staying there! No luxury but cleanness and nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Horror House Hotel !!! Stay Away !!”
Reviews.Author: Lekkerreizen
Reviews.Content: In summary the hotel was horrible. It was not value for money. If you are planning to go to London book a good comfortable hotel few week before. It started when we arrived to the hotel. Inside there is no sign of a reception. There is a small table with a guy who hardly speaks English doing a lot of paper work. When booking the hotel we paid the total up front with Credit Card and received a confirmation by email. Upon arrival the guy at the "Reception" mentioned that we only paid the booking costs and not the costs for staying in the hotel. I showed the guy the confirmation sent by email (luckily I printed it !). He admitted and apologized. Then to our room which was supposed to have a PRIVATE shower. We noticed that there is no shower in the room. When I asked the guy he said that he will show me where the shower is. I assumed that the shower was next door but it was not! We had to go downstairs, passed the "reception" and everyone who you could possibly encounter in the stairs to take a shower. In the way to the shower there was an awful smell. The stairs where very old and the showers even worse. The showers are not private at all !! Everyone uses the same showers. DO NOT BE TRICKED WHEN YOU RECEIVE AN EMAIL STATING THAT YOU WILL HAVE A PRIVATE SHOWER!. In the first email confirmation the manager stated that we would have a "Private shower". When we paid we received another email stating that we will have " A shower close to the room for sole use" and when we arrived nothing of this was true. The showers are not private...everyone takes shower in the same cabins. When you complain to the reception guy he will mention that he will talk about that with the "management department " and that he is helpless at the moment. We entered the room, very disappointed because that was not what I paid for. The room was too small for two persons. We could hardly walk to passed the beds to the washing basin. I sat on the bed and grabbed my laptop. There was this awful smell coming form underneath the bed. I shut my laptop down and went to the reception. I said that I want my money back and that I am not staying in that hotel any longer. I grabbed my stuff and when to another hotel. Somewhat expensive but more comfortable. I could have a shower in my room. Had clean, fresh and cleaned room, clean bed, clean towels and a healthy varied breakfast. I talked to few people I encountered in the hotel. It appears that everyone goes through the same trickery. PLEASE DO NOT GO THERE. PAY A LITTLE MORE AND GET YOURSELF A BETTER HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable room for a family of five.”
Reviews.Author: CMcV186470
Reviews.Content: WHH was able to accommodate our family of five in a spacious, clean room. It is a basic, no-frills hotel which suited us just fine as we only needed a clean room in which to sleep during our trip. Location was very convenient. Would use WHH again.

Reviews.Title: “7 nights in Windsor-House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: haniaM
Reviews.Content: If you are looking a budget but clean and friendly hotel in London, the Windsor-House Hotel is a good choice. I and my teeenager niece spent 7 nights there. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable, what was very important for us because we walked a lot. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The guests can use a kitchen, and it is a great idea. We didn't use it very often but one day we really needed it and it could. All information we found on their web-site are true. We were treated as the guests even if we vacate our room. We could left our luggage for a few hours and refresh before leaving. Hanna & Justyna from Poland

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly hotel and very reasonable cost!”
Reviews.Author: twiglet29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights with my family (2 adults and 3 children aged 14, 12 and 10) as we needed a base while our daughter danced in a Summer School in Hammersmith. The location was perfect - 2 minutes from Earls Court Station. We had use of the kitchen which was perfect as our daughter needed a packed lunch every day. The hotel was basic, but did include clean bedlinen, soap and towels and breakfast. As we could use the kitchen, we cooked our own meals and made our own lunches and drinks, cutting the cost even further. The children enjoyed sitting out in the garden in the evenings. We stayed on the top floor, and even though the stairs were steep and our 10 year old son has DCD, he managed really well - by the second day he was racing up and down! Would definitely recommend this hotel if you want a family friendly, low cost break in central London!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't stand the smell”
Reviews.Author: Lisab312
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about WHH B&B is the location!!! Our room was stuffy and the whole house had such a terrible smell , our room had lots of flies, Windows very dirty. Blankets had stains and there were cracks in the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Malta022
Reviews.Content: I am from Malta, a small island under Sicily in the beautiful Mediterranean sea. I have decided to go up to London alone for a holiday and for some course researching and this hotel was a great stay it was absolutely perfect for my whole stay. Since day one arriving at 01:30 in the morning taught of finding problems like you usually do in other hotels but this time was different they opened for me imediately and was directed to my room which was very warm and comfortable, bed was comfortable too to sleep in, with very clean sheets. Staff was great on stay and even on the telephone when I booked, they were kind, gentle and straight to the point I infact had to leave some tips for them as couldn't not do so or else would have felt guilty. The location is perfect as soon as you get out of the hotel and turn left you find the train station which leads to major routes in just 15 minutes and a great super market which sells really really nice fresh, affordable, healthy food. I am already booked at them for another trip in October and this time I am getting my 3 best friends with me to party hard!!! So yes I would definetly suggest this hotel to all the people around the world at a very cheap price!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepable... surprisingly.”
Reviews.Author: bemnam
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I noticed about this place was the location. Our room for 5 had: No toilet, one shower... in the same space as the bed that was see through, suspicious white stains on the blankets and a broken bed side table. So as all young girls our reaction was not very pleasant. I could sleep, although most of my friends had bad backs in the morning. If you're willing, try it.

Reviews.Title: “WHH--nice staff, hot breakfast, good coffee, big room”
Reviews.Author: thrgd456
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my family of five at WHH. It is a no frills hotel. The location is in an excellent neighborhood. The trains running to and from this station were full of people in nice suits and business attire, so I'm guessing it's a yuppie neighborhood. The hotel is literally 200 ft or less from the Earl's Court Underground station. Breakfast was prompt and hot. The coffee was flowing freely and it was good. Also the tea was good according to my wife. Our room was very large, six beds. The beds were old twin beds but they slept just fine. I am a large person and I had no trouble with the bed. The sheets were clean. There was a small writing table, one chair, a couple chests of drawers and a few bedside tables. We had a very large bathroom with a large tub, no shower. There was one electrical outlet in the room and one in the bathroom. The whole building is old and could stand to be refurbished, but it was dry (no leaks), quiet, clean and safe. The real treat were the other guests staying in the hotel. They were from different nationalities and were very nice. A couple of other attractive families and a couple of older couples. They were all very pleasant, quiet and we all got along. (I wondered about taking my family to an economy hotel). The small garden behind the hotel was also very nice, not overdone, but kept up. The staff was professional and courteous. The were honest and when I had to shorten my stay they voluntarily refunded my money. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing to stay in an economy hotel, in a safe neighborhood, super close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lyn8_10
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 star hotel, and you get what you pay for, hotel clean but could do with some updating on paint work, staff friendly, shared large room on top floor with friends, beds okay, linen clean, shower and basin in room, loo outside on landing. No mention that ther was no lift, we all managed okay but if you have problems with stairs request lower room. Great location as just round the corner (literaly)from earls court station in a quiet road, so as we were going to concerts and the theatre, plus sightseeing during the day the location was the best. Basic but that reflects the good cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly family hotel”
Reviews.Author: London041
Reviews.Content: We had a nice weekend in Spring 2010 at this nice and quiet family hotel. My wife and I and our 3 children enjoyed London very much. The hotel is near the undergroundstation at EarlÂ´s Court but yet calmly located at a small street. / Thomas Ingman, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hedgehog2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about what I expected - inexpensive but old and with few amenities. The "in-room" bathroom is not worth it - the ones downstairs are nicer and have much larger showers. There is no A/C (as is common in European hotels), and the building appears to have been built in the early 19th century. We had my entire family (5 persons) in one room, and snug is definitely the word to use. However - the location was GREAT, and the price was by far the most reasonable in London at the time. I would stay there again, albeit not in this specific room (more space, less closet-sized bathroom). If travelling in mid-summer, be aware that the rooms are not well ventilated and may be quite warm during summer nights.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: mmpall
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly enough but hotel is seriously dated and in poor state of repair. Room not as described - no tv, no tea facilities as per detailed in hotel spec!!... BE WARNED "private bathroom" may mean you have a "porta-shower" in your room (that had poor pressure and was TINY and took about 10 minutes to get bearable luke-warm) and you have to go upstairs to use the toilet. Peeling paint, soggy smelly carpets and mouldy windows. Obviously converted property as we could could the young ladies next door at 6am chatting about make up and their night out. Bed was clean but linen was threadbare/holey and had cigarette burns. Didn't bother staying for breakfast - would rather spend a fiver at the M&S down the road. Was close to Tube and had shops and a lovely Thai restaurant near by. Best part about our stay was when we left. Would happily have paid an addition Â£20 to stay in BnB chain - but we only got to our room at 9.30pm and were too tired to hassle with moving when we were just staying one night!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: CASIOQUARTZ
Reviews.Content: great location- few minutes` walk from the tube (Earl`s Court tube station has 3 lines)-great restaurants & shops at the area( Mac,Bking,M&S, etc) where you can get your fill- there`s also a proper Tesco if you want to get a value meal-- you may also cook or warm your meal at the kitchen or make a hot drink and take it to your room. We were a family of five in one room, sheets were clean -no squeaking beds & mattresses so we could have a good night`s sleep.Ultra-compact bathroom, but everything fully-functional and clean.

Reviews.Title: “good value for a good price”
Reviews.Author: psto
Reviews.Content: no luxury but for this price you can not ask more I was on three different single rooms, all were clean and had a shower (only one had a WC on room). clean, friendly (no non-sense) breakfast very basic (cornflacks, toast, 1 egg & jam) quite street 2 minutes from Earls Court Metro by foot ca. 20 minutes from Natural History Museum, Science Museum, Victoria and Albert etc.

Reviews.Title: “Re-live your student days . . .”
Reviews.Author: majaSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the month of January at the Windsor Hotel. We purposely booked an inexpensive hotel in order to stretch the research grant money I had received from my university. Our room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the shower and toilet were kept very clean for the month. Do bear in mind, though, that this is definitely a "no frills" hotel. The twin beds pushed together in our room were a disappointment (especially after they had emailed to confirm that we would have a double bed). We appreciated the convenience of having access to the kitchen for a quick meal, but the breakfasts (one boiled egg, white toast, butter and jam, cornflakes, and tea/coffee) quickly became boring, so we supplemented them with healthier fare. The hotel staff were all quite friendly and helpful. If you're not too fussy about your room and would like to relieve your student days in a dorm-like (but clean) place, this hotel is an economical alternative to London's high-priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Simple family hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mariatravels42
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at WHH. Because we travel with three teenagers we liked to stay in a friendly priced hotel, not to far from the city center. Fortunately WHH offered family rooms,even 5- and 6-bedded. Although not the spaciest of rooms we had our own, tiny, in-room toilet and shower. Room was clean, staff very friendly, breakfast adequate. People should realize that for a relatively low price per night one must not expect a lot of luxury. Earls Court underground station was just 2 minutes away. Good shops and restaurants in the immediate neighbourhood available. We enjoyed our stay and would possibly go back to this hotel if we visited London again.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal I've made”
Reviews.Author: vonKIreland
Reviews.Content: For a veery little of money I have spent 3 fantastic days in the heart of LONDON. Room in a typical building. I had a private room, bathroom, comfy bed and kitchen acces and all that for surpricely price in the heart of London. What more shell I ask for? Perfect localisation and extrymly friendly and helpful staff made the stay fantastic. Best of luck lads.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: jmwilds
Reviews.Content: Please keep in mind that there were 11 of us all together aged between 19-24 The Good- The place was very clean & the location was brilliant! We couldn't have asked for a better location. The Tube station is right around the corner, there's a lovly Bakery right across from the Tube station that does lovly pasteries & nice coffee. The Staff are very nice and helpful. The Bad- The rooms are very small, we didn't really mind cause we litterly came into the room and went straight to bed. The Lads stayed in a room of 6, and they barely had room to walk to the bathroom! The breakfast was a boiled egg & toast! They advertise a nice breakfast- and breakfast is only served from 7.30-8.45 am (hince the lovly bakery across from the Tube Station) When I first inquired about the room, the hotel asked if I would email my credit card details to pay for the room in full, I felt very uncomfortable about this so I sent a bank draft instead, which they didn't seem to like, but it worked. Their staff were very bad about responding to emails & the beds were very uncomfortable! Also, there were a lot of stairs, would not reccomend if you're elderly or have bad knees. The Ugly- The girl's room had no toilet (although there was one across the hall for another room, but not ours) and our in- room shower had a SEE THROUGH DOOR on it! We died laughing when we saw it! When we arrived, we were told that we needed to pay an additional 170 pounds even though our room had been paid in full previous to our arrival via the bank draft. I said that I wasn't paying it, and they had no issue with it (fair play to them- they were very nice about it and didn't press the issue) Overall, if you're young (or young at heart) and you're only staying in London for 1 night- it's perfect! I wouldn't stay there if I were staying for longer than one night.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: dantom123
Reviews.Content: very good location less than two minutes from the tube, a cheap clean hotel. It has a no frills low budget standard. You have a possibility to make your own lunch\dinner. Book a room with an on suit toilet . we got good service from friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “basic accommodation in great location”
Reviews.Author: leonard39
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 from South Africa and spent 2 weeks at Windsor House Hotel over the festive season . This is a basic hotel with no frills but it is clean and superbly situated in Earls Court . Guests can make use of the kitchen after 11.00 am each day which does help the pocket as London is too expensive to eat out all the time (especially when 1 BP = 12.5 SAR !) The staff were also very helpful , patient and friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Clean,friendly and 2 minutes walk from tube,which is ideal to travel in london.”
Reviews.Author: phantommalta
Reviews.Content: Do not expect any frills,but the place is clean and one can use the kitchen.They are friendly and helpful. I was there in December with my sisters and for sure we will go again. Since we where all women it was easy for us to travel from Heathrow to Earl's Court with our luggage.The only drawback was that there was not enough heating and toilets are shared. Still having said that I will recomend it especially for those people who have a bugget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel very close to underground”
Reviews.Author: TheovanEijden
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the week before christmas, and had a good time over there. Hotel was very helpfull. We could use the kitchen to make some food or hot drinks. The hotel is very very close to underground "Earls Court". Around the entrance of the undergroud are a lot of small shops and restaurants. Hotel is sober but good enough. Yust for sleep, no problem. We had a room with 5 beds and a bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Truly unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: octopus21
Reviews.Content: Over the holiday, my family came to visit me in London and we stayed for 4 nights at the Windsor House Hotel. I've stayed in many hostels, hotels, and B&Bs throughout the UK during my holiday and this was by far the worst. We reserved two double rooms during our stay. The first inconvenience began when we were informed that we couldn't pay with a credit card despite their website saying that they accepted nearly all credit cards. When I entered my parents' double room, we immediately noticed the smell. It took us about a day to figure out what it was--the bathroom was so small that the shower curtain was dangerously close to the toilet. The en-suite bathrooms were what we termed "pods"--plastic extensions that were on the whole about the size of a normal shower. My parents eventually asked to have the shower curtain changed and the smell went away. We also had no towels in our room initially and had to ask in order to get some. I then found myself needing to use my parents' shower as mine had no hot water. I was also hesitant to walk around without my shoes on--the carpet seemed very oily and dirty. It was also frustrating that there were very few outlets in either room. I had to unplug our radiator in order to have access to one. The breakfast was sparse--hard-boiled eggs, toast, and cereal--but unlimited and served with lots of tea and coffee. There were also a few staff who were very cheerful, particularly the Christmas Day attendant. There were a few other bright spots in our stay. The location was great and very close to the Earl's Court underground station. We also had use of the kitchen and the eating area, which was handy for making dinner. Overall, though conveniently located, this hotel is definitely not worth staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: acker57
Reviews.Content: London is an expensive city, especially when it comes to hotels / accomodation. I was looking for something very simple, quiet , clean and affordable where to spend a week in London. That's what Windor House is. For Â£38 / 40.00 a day I got a very clean room with shower (not en-suite) and a simple breakfast (enough to start a day). Ok, no TV, no telephone, no internet, but if there was a tv set, for example, I would spend my nights seeing tv, "ruinning" the day after ! So, it is not a place to stay during the day but a quite and clean place where to keep your things and sleep. Earl's Court tube station is really just around the corner, making it easy to go everywhere. If you want to take food to the hotel, the kitchen is open to guests and there is a Marks & Spencers "Simply Food" shop 50 meters far from the hotel. Two internet shops are really nearby. I recommend Windor House : good value for the price ! And friendly people too. But if you are looking for real luxury, go to ... the House of Windsors (call Beth or Phil). AndrÃ© Acker, from Rio de Janeiro, Brasil

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful, a comfortable and clean place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: magicwine
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Windsor House B&B for a couple of nights, early November. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the location is excellent being a couple of minutes from Earls Court tube station and to the museums of South Kensington. I stayed in a small room facing the street, it was clean and had a shower and sink in the room, toilet was across the hall. Perfectly adequate for what I needed and the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best value for a great location.”
Reviews.Author: NaneNSW
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Windsor House two times now. Set in a quiet back street, it is minutes from the underground, shops, pubs and cafes. Access to the kitchen is a great help in summer as items can be stored in the fridge for salads and sandwiches. There is no microwave though. The rooms are basic but perfectly adequate. We were given a TV but there was nowhere to plug it in - no matter, we don't watch TV anyway. The stairs are very steep and narrow, and this is an issue when carrying heavy cases. Both times we stayed there we were promised a room on the first floor. However, despite booking well in advance, when we arrived we were still given a room up several flights of stairs. I don't quite understand why they can't get this right. But we managed, and didn't let it spoil the holiday. Even with these minor irritations, we would still stay at Windsor House again, and recommend it. You won't find anywhere cheaper or more central, and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “From France - A girly sightseeing weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Alex1050
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well situated, a minute's walk from Earl's court tube station. We stayed in a triple room with three beds and had a laughing fit when we saw the layout. The room was higher than it was wide and the shower was too small for my (very) round friend. We quickly came to the conclusion that we were here to visit London, not to bum in the room. After the first night we concluded that the room was just fine. Quiet. Comfortable beds. No allergies from dust mites which is my own personal hell when I travel. The other nice surprise was that although it was extremely quiet for London (sleeping with window open!) there was a good selection of restaurants and diners in the area. Breakfast was simple but we did get to raid the kitchen for midnight tea which was lovely. I wouldn't suggest this as a romantic place to wow your girlfriend but for a girl's weekend away it was absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in Central London”
Reviews.Author: traveltipper9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a leisure trip with my young children and was satisfied more than I expected.Website of the hotel very honestly describe the basic facilities it provides,atleast it doesn't try to lure the customers with false promises.Excellent location in central London,very near to earl's court subway and many tourist locations at walking distance.Staff is helpful.Standard of cleanliness even with minimum staff is very high.Bathrooms inside the room as well as on the floor are very clean and fully functional with running hotwater.Once inside it lacks present day glamour but attracts you with its English atmosphere especially the dinning room in the basement with its little garden.A definite advantage of this hotel is the facility to utilize the kitchen.After spending a hectic day,rather than eating a quick dinner you can bring some grocery to cook and enjoy your time in the comfortable dinning room.Read some magazine or watch t.v. or review your pics of the day. before going to your room.All types of restaurants including indian and pakistani food ,pharmacies,grocery shops,outlet for buying advance tickets of tourist locations are in the immediate vicinity. Breakfast is a plus point,it is generous and served in a very caring manner.Serving staff is very happy to cater for your small needs of hot tea and coffee plus rest of the things.If you get up late still after 10 a.m the kitchen is open and you can serve yourself. All the guests were very well mannered and there was no noise in the hotel or in the vicinity. The website of the hotel promises basic facilities and provides them.It is not for the snobs with extra requirements of leisure and pleasure in the hotel but for straightforward tourists who want to economize as well as look forward to a comfortable stay and base near central London attractions.There is no elevator so avoid carrying one heavy piece of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “WHH is undeniably well-located, modest but homely plus the staff is really efficient. A must. Real value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: AngieVerdu
Reviews.Content: My stay at Windsor House Hotel (WHH) was way beyond what I expectedâ€¦ for the better. I live in Patagonia in Argentina, an idyllic paradise. At the beginning of the year, I travelled to Spain to visit my sister and her family who live there after five years. Quite a long time for not having seen the people you love so dearly. Anyway, during my time there, a friend of my brother-in-lawâ€™s got my sister, her newly born IvÃ¡n and me inexpensive tickets to London. Everything was a bit rush, but, in the end, it turned out great. I found WHH on the web and their friendly tone really attracted me from scratch, especially if you consider this was my first trip to Europe on my own and to London with a baby, as well as my first hotel booking online. For starters, I was a bit unsure about the whole thing but, at WHH, they made it really easy for us to pay for our room, given we donâ€™t have a credit card. I just made a bank deposit and faxed the receipt. As simple as that! It is true that the hotel is well-located. Plus the instructions on the site on how to get from the tube station to the hotel were extremely clear and simple to follow, which came in handy. Really crystal clear indeed! The efficient people at the reception were utterly kind the minute we met them, helping us upstairs with all our luggage (that travelling with a baby was considerable, to say the least). I loved our room as soon as I entered. We had our own shower and the bathroom we had was shared but, in our case, no one else was staying on that section of the hotel at the time so, I can proudly say we had our own bathroom. Everything was clean and tidy at all times. The truth is that there are no luxuries, which is logical for what they charge but itâ€™s undeniable that they are truly homely. At the reception, they had all kinds of brochures and leaflets on excursions and sight-seeing tours you could take for free. The kitchen was fully-equipped and always available. In the dining room, we even had a TV we could use whenever we wished. Then, breakfast was quite conventional but delicious and I wouldnâ€™t have added anything else to it. The good thing was you coud have as much as you needed and the people that waited on us were totally adorable and polite. On the whole, in my opinion, WHH is certainly family-friendly, as they claim on the site, and is unquestionably highly recommended. Next time Iâ€™m in London, Iâ€™ll definitely pay them a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Never got to stay Hurray!”
Reviews.Author: pianodeb
Reviews.Content: We had credit card confirmation for a room for two nights and when we arrived they had no record of it. Also no rooms availaible, even though I had a confrimation number. They were not helpful at all. I had to go down the street to another hotel and luckily find a room myself. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location with good value!”
Reviews.Author: chateldon
Reviews.Content: It was very close from Earl's court and there was Marks and Spencer nearby. I arrived very late, however hotel people were very flexible and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel to stay in london”
Reviews.Author: dtheuma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with another 6 persons, so we were 7 in all. We had a great room on the ground floor just how we requested. Location is great with circle, district and piccadilly lines coming and going all the time. It is just round the cornere from the station and the bus stops there as well. Shops and restaurants are in the area with great good and cheap food. The hotel"s kitchen is great if u you want to save money on food. Cleanliness everywhere, hot water everyday for a nice warm shower after a long day out in London. Staff very helpful and friendly. Windsor house hotel is ideal for young and old, infact this was my second visit there in 6 months and i will certainly stay there everytime i go to London.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Tintim
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews, I was impressed by the complete different opinions: some very good and some very bad. I discovered for myself that good opinions can only be justified with astroturfing. This was the worst hotel ever. Everything went wrong: - when we arrive, our friends discovered they had not toilet in the room. Was not possible bedroom change and they have to get out of the room to get to the toilet.. - the kitchen does not have microwave and some elementary things - bread in the breakfast is handled with the hands and some other eccentric experiences - service, provided by asian guys, is rude - we asked to keep our luggage between checkout and going to the airport, when I arrived my luggage was in others guest room, with im insido of the room - we suspect that cards used to pay the hotel were used in Internet fraud.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay/location/price”
Reviews.Author: Harrycito
Reviews.Content: I have been in Windsor House Hotel already many times, I regularly commute to London and in my bad/busy/ times this small, cosy hotel have always offered me the best price and accommodation in the area. I love the sense of staying in a Victorian high ceiling building and being able to eat my a take away in its kitchen and a beer in a sweet garden (that's what we did last time with some American family and Australians friends who were visiting as well). I found Windsor house very easy to reach, the staff is friendly, location a super plus and the rooms very clean (this is what my partner commented last time she was with me there) ahj a lift would make this place a bit heaven for me.. I simply find this hotel my cup of tea.... I would recommend to any of my friends and colleagues to stay in this any time. in fact some of them were already. ps. winters offers are cheap, and you will always find loads of families cooking great meals around the evening so you wont feel any lonely!

Reviews.Title: “Budget accommodation, value for money”
Reviews.Author: MarieandJohn54
Reviews.Content: Very close to the underground and London central. Quiet, clean suburb and accommodation. Rooms adequate with ensuite. Breakfast a good start for the day, and the use of kitchen to prepare our meals a big plus,as London's restaurants expensive for the quality and size of meals. Only negative of our stay was no lift and internet. Would definitely come back. Marie & John (Goolwa, SA, Australia)

Reviews.Title: “disgusting b&b stay away!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers1
Reviews.Content: We booked this b&b in part due to somewhat normal reviews here on Trip Advisor and it was a convenient location in earl's court with loads of shops, restaurants and a tube station nearby. we normally stay in King's Cross in london but thought we would try this location for a change. When we arrived after a very long flight, i was not concered by the outer appearance as most London b&b's look old outside but can be quite normal inside. The front deskman was very nice and welcoming, but the room itself had me burst into tears at the thought of staying even one night in this manky place. the door to the room wouldnt open as the lock was half busted, It was not clean, the furnishings are ancient and disgusting, the matresses was sagging in the middle and must have been 50 years old, with broken springs, the in room toilet/shower is ridiculously tiny, even by London standards and I am not sure how anyone could actually fit in there to shower - my husband called it the [--] & shower special! we left that night and didnt even spend the night, it was too awful, i started breaking out in hives from all the dust in the room (parts of the wall were falling off!!) and i would have been scared to take my shoes off and walk on the gross carpet. I have stayed in some dives but this is the worst I have seen. we went to King's Cross instead where there are loads of normal b&b's to choose from and wont make you cry just looking at them! shame on them for the money they charge per night and the disgusting rooms they provide at this rate.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay.”
Reviews.Author: marina_micro
Reviews.Content: WindsorHouseHotel is the best choice for a leisure trip with friends.I have to say that is not suitable for a romantic trip nor for elderly people.The room fits only the beds and the bathroom is very small but when someone goes to London it is the last thing to think!Breakfast is simple with bread,marmalade,butter,eggs,coffee or tea and almost satisfying. Ihave been to London many times but I stayed only once here.Definetely I would stay here again expept for going with my boyfriend.Tip:get a room with shared room because the shared toilets and showers are much better and comfortable than the ensuited and you gain more money to spend elsewhere!Hve a wonderfull time in London!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, good location, excellent value in the low budget class!”
Reviews.Author: meggie09
Reviews.Content: We ( a family with 4 children between 7-16 years) stayed in the WHH for the easter week and had a really good time. To begin with, the lady that answered my email inquiery was very friendly und patient to answer my numerous questions and helped me find the best option for us which was a 6bed room for the incredibly fair price of 94 pounds per day for the six of us including breakfast (Easter special, normally it a bit more)! The room was very nice and quite spacious, with a big window overlooking the little garden and a high ceiling We had six single beds (no bunks!) and a bathroom. The only drawback was the fact that it had only a bathtub and no shower (other rooms do have showers!), but there are community showers in the basement that we used - no problem! The rooms were cleaned almost every day and the beds made - something I did not expect in a low budget place! Except for a faint noise from the nearby tubestation( 5min. walk - great!) it is a very quiet place (no noisy parties at night!), and we woke up to birds singing in the garden every morning! Breakfast was served in the basement breakfast room ajourning to the kitchen that could be used from 11.am. - 10p.m. Breakfast was tea, coffee and milk, cornflakes, toast and jam as much as we liked and a boiled egg. It was really great to be able to use the kitchen as eating out is so expensiv and the kitchen is well equipped and clean with fridges that can be used by the quests. We also enjoyed the garden for a quiet rest in the sun between sightseeing. The staff at the reception was very friendly and helpfull. If you are expecting luxury, this is the wrong place for you, but if you want a clean, friendly and comfortable low budget place to stay, go there! We will surely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it, it's really a dump of a place”
Reviews.Author: mickey_cruisin
Reviews.Content: Did not like this place. Actually I can't believe I stayed even if it were just for three nights. My boyfriend booked this dump and we stayed here as we were meeting up with some friends who had traveled from Brighton to see us. It was more like an over-priced hostel than a hotel. Lumpy beds, blankets with a stench and unprofessional staff. Cash payment up front; that was weird or an extra charge to your credit card. The area is not as bad people speak of Earl's Court but if you can afford to do just a bit better then by all means do so. Avoid this nightmare if you can---seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: OAXACA15
Reviews.Content: The Windsor House Hotel provides exactly what the web-site promises: a homey and clean setting with no frills. It offers access to Central London by tube or bus from the Earl Court Station, clean facilities, and a very helpful and accommodating staff. It's in walking distance to the South Kensington museums, and Holland Park. It was my travelling companion's first trip to Europe (from Latin America) and he described the B&B and neighbourhood as being what he imagined England would look like.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: katwalesCardiff
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for about 25 pounds each per night. Brilliant value for money considering it's London and proximity to the Tube. The hotel itself is a bit dilapidated and as long as you think "I'm just here to sleep" then it's ok. Our "en-suite" was a shower in the corner of the room and sink, with a toilet outside the room for our use only. Therefore the room smelled a bit damp. In terms of cleanliness, there were a couple of stains on the carpet, but the sheets on the bed were immaculate and pressed, which is what is important. The breakfast is awful, we didn't have it after our first experience. They are trying to keep the costs down, so it is thin, cheap toast with jam and a hard boiled egg, with nasty coffee/tea, but considering the price you wouldn't expect breakfast at all in other places. Most people have previously said that the staff were rude, but they answered all enquiries and kept us informed. They just weren't overly chatty.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing for your money”
Reviews.Author: kellyincolonie
Reviews.Content: Okay its not the Ritz if you get that out if your head you will be fine. We were on a girls week and it was great. the price was excellent. Breakfast was ok. It was toast, jam, coffee, or tea, hard boiled egg and corn flakes thats it, fine for us most of the time, I was the only one out of five that went down to breakfast most days and coffee was fine.I took the first shower and tried to get out of the way. We had five beds in the room and a small dresser for each and enough space to hang everything. The bathroom is just a funny story to tell. We managed and if five woman can anyone can.Lets just say, take your pants off before your shower and dont run the water full blast. Bathroon was small. You can use the toilets downstairs.Staff was okay not super friendly but not rude. We had toweles when we needed them, just ask.We even had a liitle explosion with our converter which didnt seem to surprise them it knocked out the power and when we returned they had it fixed.Location wa excellent,close to everthing you could want, tube 2 minutes grocery store and restaurants 2 minutes even a pharmacy which we needed for an ace bandage(sprained ankle). Bottom line well worth unless you are looking for super elegant. Very clean, great location, excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: dogtiredwoof
Reviews.Content: The Windsor House Hotel is a great deal, with a great location. We had 6 in our room (parents and 4 kids). Our room was on the main floor. Our room had a large bathroom with a bath tub. (there were a few showers in the basement that we were allowed to use). The hotel itself is a 2 min walk from Earls Court Underground Station (and that is walking with 4 kids and 10 bags!) It is a 15 min walk to Kennsington Palace, and 10 min walk to "The Big Bus" bus stop. For breakfast they had toast, jam, boiled egg, coffee and tea. The rooms were clean, (well serface clean, nooks and crannies not so much attention, reminded me of home! lol) The beds had plenty of blankets, the heaters provided enough heat for the room. My bed had a spring that stuck out right about my kneecap, I meant to mention it to the manager, but I forgot. I am sure they would have helped me out had I complained, but I was far too tired to be too concerned about the spring!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, value for money but you gotta laugh about the place”
Reviews.Author: Robyn_NZ
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay if you go into it with the mind set that you are just there to sleep and to be fair the price of places to stay central in London is extortion so this place is a pretty good deal considering. The best bit is if your lucky you will come home with a funny story about staying there like we did. There was six of us staying in one room and when we got there we were told that on your second night we would have to move rooms which was o.k We got into our room and there was no shower only a bath ( for six people ha,ha) and the only thing protecting the rest of the room from seeing you in it was a flimsy see through shower curtain and some glass doors. The second night I made sure there was going to be a shower in our room and the Man assured me there would be. So we got back after a very long day and six of us had to get ready for a party that night and when we got to our new room the shower was just in the corner of the room!!! I kidd you not no curtain or anything standing there like a wardrobe, we just had to laugh because unless you are very good friends no-one is going to use it. Luckily there were showers on the level below for the other rooms so we just used them instead, but the pressure was pretty poor. Overall we had a good laugh at the experience, the staff were really nice and the place was clean cant ask for much more. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, nice people”
Reviews.Author: LeilaBustoA_Italy
Reviews.Content: I started going to Windsor House Hotel in 2004 and I still go whether I am alone in London for a theatre break or I have some friends to show around the city. Fantastic location, very nice and friendly people, kitchen facilities, rooms small but clean and they even give you towels! And the price is a very reasonable one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for sleeping. Do not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: NastjaKranjc
Reviews.Content: I have read some reviews about Windsor House Hotel, and most of them match with my experience there. What is good in this place? Location and prices! Are you hungry at 3.00 am? No problem! Just go out and look for some place to eat. You can find McDonalds, Burger King, Marks&Spencer, Chinese food, Pakistanese food, Indian Food... whatever you want. And yes, there are plenty of them that never close. Less than one minute walk from Earls Court Station. I dare to say that you wont be able to find anywhere in London with such a very-well located place with such prices. And I mean it! My bed was pretty good too. Well, but it is not Heaven at all. Rooms are VERY small. No toilets inside the rooms. Some toilets do not work properly. The showers are not that great since i had some problems with water heating. My room looked clean, but i cant say the same about the kitchen. Terrible breakfast, by the way... Staff friendly, but not all of them. Are you planning to go alone (or with some friends) and use this hotel just for sleeping? Go ahead! I am sure it is the best choice. Are you planning a romantic honey moon? Are you looking for great meals and any kind of luxuries? Definately it is not the place you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Linny600
Reviews.Content: Price and location were the main reasons for booking this hotel. Good Points: Clean, very friendly and accomodating staff, price, kitchen. I booked this for myself and my mother. Unfortunately my mother had flu and bronchitis at the time so the many stairs were a big problem. The kitchen is clean and tidy and you can use it to make meals or simply a tea and coffee. Breakfast was simple but enough. The staff are all friendly and accomodating. Less than 2 mins walk to Earls Court Tube station and plenty of supermarkets and restaurants/take aways within walking distance. Bad Points: Stairs.. if you can't handle stairs, don't book here. Things to improve on: Rooms could do with a lick of paint. For smokers there is no ashtray provided outside. Matresses were a bit on the old side, but comfortable enough. If you plan on spending a lot of time in your room, possibly not a good choice, but as a base great. All in all I'd recommend this hotel. It does what it says on the tin. CHEAP N CHEERFUL

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our trip”
Reviews.Author: hojuma
